title: Ahmaud Arbery Murder Trial: Prosecutor Rejects Self-Defense Claims
sub_head: Closing arguments begin in case of three defendants charged with murder and assault; jury to consider citizen-arrest law
body:
Closing arguments began Monday in the trial of the three Georgia men charged in the murder of Ahmaud Arbery, with the prosecution attacking defense claims that the men acted legally under citizen-arrest and self-defense laws.
Travis McMichael, 35 years old, is accused of chasing Mr. Arbery with his father, Gregory McMichael, 65, and William “Roddie” Bryan Jr., 52, in two pickup trucks on Feb. 23, 2020. Travis McMichael shot Mr. Arbery three times with a 12-gauge shotgun, according to court records and video of the incident. The three men face charges including murder and aggravated assault.
